column4: Hey, can anyone help me set up a terminal button involving xwinwrap? I have a neat setup for it but I can't seem to make a launcher button- it works fine in a normal terminal.
sorry about the guest name thing
anyone have any ideas?
Hey, can anyone help me set up a terminal button involving xwinwrap? I have a neat setup for it but I can't seem to make a launcher button- it works fine in a normal terminal.
did you check the "run in terminal" box in the launcher preferences?
where would that be? I haven't worked with this in awhile and the last time i tried was in 8.10, one sec
for some reason that's not working... hmm
right-click the launcher, then select "Properties".  Change "Type" to "Application In Terminal"
the command i'm running is this: xwinwrap -ni -o 0.6 -fs -s -st -sp -b -nf -- mplayer -wid WID -quiet ~/Desktop/testlegs.avi -loop 0 -nosound -fs
what happens when you click the launcher after changing the type?
it does nothing.. when i open a terminal and paste in the exact same command it works fine
ive also tried putting it in startup and it does nothing =\
i did just install gnome-do if that would change anything
I use gnome-do myself and haven't had it mess anything up
kk one second
adding && sleep 10 does nothing, it opens a terminal breifly then crashes it
that is VERY strange...
it worked fine in 8.10 or 8.04 im not sure what's changed :\
do you know of a way to just launch a terminal and then run a command?
try "bash <command>" in the launcher
no luck :(
